weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, a veil of rain drapes itself across the city, the air thick with promise and a chill that whispers of the evening to come. With the low hovering around a cool 51 degrees, the scene is bathed in soft gray, the clouds looming heavy overhead, a harbinger of the anticipated downpour. A gentle southwest wind stirs, its playful gusts reaching up to 22 mph, rustling leaves and carrying the scent of wet earth, though the heart of the city feels the rhythmic patter of raindrops beginning their descent.

The forecast for tomorrow suggests a continuation of this mood, with rain likely and temperatures that will hover in the upper 50s, gradually cooling as the day unfolds. The marine layer hangs close, lending an ethereal quality to the skyline, wrapping the iconic Golden Gate Bridge in an embrace of fog, transforming familiar landmarks into shadowy silhouettes. For evening adventures, a water-resistant jacket and sturdy footwear are prudent choices to navigate the slick streets, perhaps leading to a cozy café where one can sip warm coffee amidst the soothing symphony of raindrops. A stroll through the quiet, mist-laden avenues of the city might offer a contemplative respite, allowing the revelatory embrace of a San Francisco winter evening to unfold, if only for a moment.
